name: HedgehogPlatformer
shortDescription: This is an extension for 360Â° movement platformer akin to the Sonic The Hedgehog games.
description: An advanced platformer extension with unique physics made using events that replicate physics from games like Sonic The Hedgehog.
- Features familiar with built-in platformer extension.
- Slope movement system that allows wall running and ceil attachment.
## In comparison to built-in platformer, this extension has:
- Moving along slopes with no slope max angle limits.
- Make players run on ceilings (or bounce off them).
- Increase and/or reduce player speed based on the angle of the ground.
- Allows multiple physic executions per frame, useful to handle collisions at high speeds.
- Checks for wall pushing, under ceilings and on floor.
- 'Draws raycasts of physics' action for debugging.
- Manipulable "Time scale" of physics via action.
## For documentation and usage visit: https://sites.google.com/view/hedgd/home

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Get the platforms manager of an instance container.
* Manages the common objects shared by objects having a
* platform behavior: in particular, the platforms behaviors are required to
* declare themselves (see PlatformObjectsManager.addPlatform) to the manager
/** Platforms near the object, updated with `_updatePotentialCollidingObjects`.
* Add a platform to the list of existing platforms.
* Remove a platform from the list of existing platforms. Be sure that the platform was
* Returns all the platforms around the specified object.
* @param {number} maxMovementLength The maximum distance, in pixels, the object is going to do.
// Filter the potential colliding platforms to ensure that the object owning the behavior
// is not considered as colliding with itself, in the case that it also has the
* Returns all the platforms around the specified object.
* @param {number} maxMovementLength The maximum distance, in pixels, the object is going to do.
* @param {gdjs.RuntimeBehavior[]} result An array with all platforms near the object.
// TODO: This would better be done using the object AABB (getAABB), as (`getCenterX`;`getCenterY`) point
// is not necessarily in the middle of the object (for sprites for example).
// Extra check on the platform owner AABB
// TODO: PR https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop/pull/2602 should remove the need
// for this extra check once merged.
// Filter platforms that are not in the searched area anymore.
// This can happen because platforms are not updated in the RBush before that
let sqDistMin = rayX * rayX + rayY * rayY;
const result = isObjectOnRay(object, sourceX, sourceY, targetX, targetY, true);
const dotProduct = rayX * this.normalX + rayY * this.normalY;
* PlatformRuntimeBehavior represents a behavior allowing objects to be
* considered as a platform by objects having PlatformerObject Behavior.
//Note that we can't use getX(), getWidth()... of owner here: The owner is not fully constructed.
if ( sceneManager ) //Remove the object from any old scene manager.
//Make sure the platform is or is not in the platforms manager.
/** Build a new object to store raycast test results.
* Arrays and data structure that are (re)used by Polygon.raycastTest to
* @type {{p: FloatPoint, q: FloatPoint, r: FloatPoint, s: FloatPoint, deltaQP: FloatPoint, axis: FloatPoint, result: gdjs.RaycastTestResult}}
* Please note that the polygon must be **convex**!
* You can read the result but do not keep a reference to it as it's a static object
* reused between function calls. If you need to keep the results, use `copyRaycastTestResult`.
* For some theory, check Find the Intersection Point of Two Line Segments.
* @param startX {number} The raycast start point X
* @param startY {number} The raycast start point Y
* @param endX {number} The raycast end point X
* @param endY {number} The raycast end point Y
* @return {gdjs.RaycastTestResult} A raycast result with the contact points and distances. Do NOT keep a reference to this.
// Ray segment: p + t*r, with p = start and r = end - start
// Project the ray and the edge to work on floats, keeping linearity through t
result.closeSqDist = t1 * t1 * (r[0] * r[0] + r[1] * r[1]);
result.farSqDist = t2 * t2 * (r[0] * r[0] + r[1] * r[1]);
* destination before copying the existing source inside it.
* Return the squared bounding radius of an object given its width/height and its center of rotation
* (relative to the top-left of the object). The radius is relative to the center of rotation.
* @param endX {number} The raycast end position X
* @param endY {number} The raycast end position Y
* @param closest {boolean} Get the closest or farthest collision mask result?
* @return {gdjs.RaycastTestResult} A raycast result with the contact points and distances
// First check if bounding circles are too far
// As an optimization, avoid computing the square root of the two boundings radius
// and the distance by comparing the squared values instead.
// Do a real check if necessary.
const hitBoxes = object.getHitBoxesAround(x, y, endX, endY);
const res = raycastTest(hitBox, x, y, endX, endY);
const hitBoxes = object.getHitBoxesAround(x, y, endX, endY);
const res = raycastTest(hitBox, x, y, endX, endY);

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Adds the physics & movements of the hedgehog platformer character (the players or npc's).

eventsFunctions.description: Runs the ground physics on the object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveOnGround

events.comment:
Slope factor (capping speed to max speed)
- Speed goes through top speed limits and is capped to max speed.

Left and right input on ground (speed capped to top speed)
- When the character is already running at a higher speed than he can possibly achieve on his own, his speed must not be capped.
Speed (ground speed) transformation to horizontal and vertical speeds
Move the object and set ground angle
Set current position to last position saved to evade jitter
Floor collision and floor detect range
Reset position by floor detect range

eventsFunctions.description: Runs the airborne physics on the object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveOnAir
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the object _PARAM0_ on air against _PARAM2_

events.comment:
Left and right input on air (horizontal speed capped to top horizontal speed)
- When the character is already flying at a higher speed than he can possibly achieve on his own, his speed must not be capped.

"Where is air drag?"
No input check (air friction)
Move the object, gravity application and speed capping
Floor collision and floor detect range
Reset position by floor detect range

Collision formula to obtain angle

Custom object points to throw raycasts

propertyDescriptors.label: Identification
propertyDescriptors.description: The unique ID of the object on the scene
propertyDescriptors.name: Id

propertyDescriptors.label: Default controls
propertyDescriptors.description: de/activate default controls (use the simulation actions if deactivated)
propertyDescriptors.name: DefaultControls

propertyDescriptors.label: Jump height reducer (0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Vertical speed is changed by this value when jump input is not received after (or in the middle) of a jump (only works with jump frames)
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpHeightReducer

propertyDescriptors.label: Jump frames (The amount of frames that unables landing after a jump)
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpFrames

propertyDescriptors.label: Max speed (affects X and Y speed on ground)
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Max horizontal speed (airborne)
propertyDescriptors.description: The maximum horizontal speed while airborne
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxXSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Max vertical speed (airborne)
propertyDescriptors.description: The maximum vertical speed while airborne
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxYSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Slope factor minimum angle
propertyDescriptors.description: In angles equal or higher, deceleration isn't applied, but slope factor values are instead
propertyDescriptors.name: SlopeFactorAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Friction
propertyDescriptors.description: Speed loss by no input (only in angles below slope factor angle)
propertyDescriptors.name: Friction

propertyDescriptors.label: Floor raycast range
propertyDescriptors.description: Range of rays casted on the object sides which returns the ground angle.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloorRaycastRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Ceil raycast range
propertyDescriptors.description: Range of rays casted on the object sides which returns the ceil angle.
propertyDescriptors.name: CeilRaycastRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Floor detection range
propertyDescriptors.description: Object position changes by this value, then checks if it's touching grass, then goes back to the original position.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloorDetectRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Floor magnet
propertyDescriptors.description: Object position changes by this value when it's grounded, to keep it grounded in a sudden high-speed slip.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloorMagnet

propertyDescriptors.label: Ceil detection range
propertyDescriptors.description: Object position changes by this value, then checks if it's touching a ceilling, then goes back to the original position.
propertyDescriptors.name: CeilDetectRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Minimum angle for ground unattach
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects with an equal or higher ground angle will unattach from the floor/ceiling (if the minimun speed is applied).
propertyDescriptors.name: UnattachMinimumAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Minimum speed for ground unattach
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects with an equal or lower speed will unattach (and slip) from the floor/ceiling if it's in the unattachment angle range (make it negative to unattach if you go too fast).
propertyDescriptors.name: UnattachMinimumSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Ceil bounce factor
propertyDescriptors.description: Applies a multiplication on the Y speed when hitting a ceiling (0: Speed loss, 1: No speed loss, +1: Ceil sticking, -0: Ceil bounce)
propertyDescriptors.name: CeilBounceFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Time scale
propertyDescriptors.description: The time scale of the hedgehog physics.
propertyDescriptors.name: TimeScale

propertyDescriptors.label: Pixel per frame unit
propertyDescriptors.description: Uses pixels per frame on behavior speed properties instead of pixels per second.
propertyDescriptors.name: UsePixelPerFrame

propertyDescriptors.label: Frame-independent movement
propertyDescriptors.description: Use verlet integration + time delta formula for frame-independent movement.
propertyDescriptors.name: FrameIndependent

propertyDescriptors.label: Top horizontal speed (airborne)
propertyDescriptors.description: The top horizontal speed in air obtained with input
propertyDescriptors.name: TopXspeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Top speed
propertyDescriptors.description: The top speed in ground obtained with input
propertyDescriptors.name: TopSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed-based floor magnet
propertyDescriptors.description: Reduces or increases floor magnet depending on object's current speed
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedBasedMagnet

propertyDescriptors.label: Use alternate physics (experimental)
propertyDescriptors.description: Activate to use the new physics that return ground angle with collisions.
propertyDescriptors.name: UseAlternatePhysics

propertyDescriptors.label: Collision layer
propertyDescriptors.description: Only interacts with platforms of the same layer.
propertyDescriptors.name: CollisionLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Old horizontal speed
propertyDescriptors.description: The horizontal speed in previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: OldSpeedX

propertyDescriptors.label: Old vertical speed
propertyDescriptors.description: The vertical speed in previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: OldSpeedY

propertyDescriptors.name: IsOnFloor

propertyDescriptors.name: IsPushing

propertyDescriptors.label: Old x position of the platformer

propertyDescriptors.label: Old y position of the platformer
propertyDescriptors.name: OldY

propertyDescriptors.label: Original angle of the object

propertyDescriptors.label: Got attached to a surface
